events.title: Defense Complaint Filed
events.description: Bobbi Sternheim sends a formal complaint via email detailing restrictive conditions, surveillance, mail issues, and health concerns for her client Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney alleges her client is subject to punitive, restrictive, and inconsistent conditions at the Metropolitan Detention Center, including invasive surveillance while showering.
Maxwell's legal review is hampered as the MDC computer turns off every two hours and cannot open all discovery documents, prompting a request for extended use of a personal laptop.
Maxwell's cell is described as cold with precipitation on the walls, and a blanket was removed over a holiday weekend, after which she developed the onset of a cold.
Maxwell is subjected to frequent open-mouth, wanding, and pat-down searches, and her cell and legal papers are searched multiple times a day, disrupting her legal work.
Maxwell had not received daily newspapers for almost three weeks and had not received certified and non-certified mail that had been delivered to the facility.
